text:
Hi Guys, I am Laura Vitale. On this episode
of Laura in the Kitchen I am going to show

you how to make Brownie Cheesecake Bites.
These have been so crazy requested and I have

been putting it off for a very long time but,
I don't know why. So now it's time to go ahead

and make them. First thing you are going to
do is to go over the ingredients so we can

get started. You are going to need some semi-sweet
chocolate chips, granulated sugar, all purpose

flour, eggs, unsalted butter, vanilla extract,
cocoa powder, salt, egg yolk, bit more sugar

and some cream cheese. Those are your ingredients
to make these bites of absolute heaven. I

love, love these things, but they are dangerous
because I can't stop eating them. They have

my two favorite things, cheesecake and brownie,
all together. It is like impossible to resist

them. First thing you want to do is get your
oven to 350F. Second thing you want to do is

take a mini muffin tin and line them with
little muffin liners. You can do this with

regular cupcake tins if you don't have the
mini ones, you just won't get 30 of them,

probably will get about a dozen and cooking
time will vary. Obviously! OK! Let's get started,

we are going to take the semi-sweet chocolate
chips and butter, and all I am going to do is

put this in the microwave until they are melted
and going to make sure to stir them until

they are all combined. It will take about
a minute or so. Make sure you keep an eye

on them. That looks perfect! In this big bowl,
we are going to add the sugar and the eggs

and I am just going to whisk them for about
a minute. I want them to be really light and

fluffy. This is going to be my workout for
the day, just go ahead and mix those up. That

looks awesome! Now to that we are going to
add our melted chocolate mixture with the

butter, put that right in there. Also going
to add the vanilla extract, just mix that

up. Looks good! Time for our flour, cocoa
and salt. Just mix those in to combine and

don't over mix though and just make sure to
mix just till you don't see the raw flour

anymore. This looks Awesome! Now, I am going
to use a small ice cream scoop and you want

to fill these about two thirds of the way
full, you don't want to fill them up all the

way. That is perfect because we are going
to top them with a cheesecake filling that

we are going to make as soon as I have these
filled up. Last one! Just going to set these

aside, wash my hands, get a clean bowl, so
we can make our cheesecake filling. To make

the cream cheese filling, all we are going
to do is add the cream cheese into this bowl

and it is really important that the cream
cheese is a room temperature, it needs to

be really soft in order for this to blend
well. We are going to need one egg yolk, little

bit of sugar and I am just going to use my
whisk and get this all mixed up. That's it!

It is as simple as that! I know it doesn't
look like a lot because you are just going

to need about a teaspoon in order to just
put - just like so. Just put one teaspoon

right in there and that's it. You don't have
to mix it or twirl it in. Nothing, it is as

simple as that. Now these are going into preheated
oven for about 20 minutes or until you insert

tooth pick into the middle and it comes out
a tiny bit moist, not wet. It will take about

20 minutes and then we will let them cool
completely before digging in. These baked

for 20 minutes and I let them cool completely
and they are absolutely done! All I am going

to do is pop them on a plate and it is as
simple as that. Just to go the extra mile

here and what I really love to do, and I will
do it on a few of them so you can see is to

just kind of dust them with confectioners
sugar. They look pretty, they give a little

extra touch of sweetness. A little touch of
sweetness never hurt anybody, simple as that.

To get this recipe and others, you know where
to go www.laurainthekitchen.com and I will
see you next time. Bye bye!
I don't know what possessed me, but I forgot to take a bite.  Unacceptable in my book.   So Good!
